      • getActions

        public List<ResourceToolAction> getActions(ResourceToolAction.ActionType type)
        Description copied from interface: ResourceType
        Access the action specified by the parameter. If the action is defined for this resource type, it is returned. Otherwise, the method returns null.
        Specified by:
        getActions in interface ResourceType
        Returns:

      • getActions

        public List<ResourceToolAction> getActions(List<ResourceToolAction.ActionType> types)
        Description copied from interface: ResourceType
        Access an ordered list of actions specified by the parameter. The actions are added to the list in the order specified by the parametric list. If none of the action types specified in the list are defined for this resource type, the returned list will be empty.
        Specified by:
        getActions in interface ResourceType
        Returns:

      • getLocalizedHoverText

        public String getLocalizedHoverText(ContentEntity member)
        Access a text string suitable for use as a very brief description of a particular resource. If the string is more than about 40 or 50 characters, it may be truncated at an arbitrary length. The string may identify the type of this resource or more specific information. The string should be localized. If no value is supplied, a default hover-string will be used.
        Specified by:
        getLocalizedHoverText in interface ResourceType
        Parameters:
        member - The resource that's being displayed
        Returns:
        i18n label of the form type

      • isExpandable

        public boolean isExpandable()
        Description copied from interface: ResourceType
        Indicates whether this resource type is one for which an "expand" action is available. If this method returns true, the ResourceType registration must implement the ExpandableResourceType interface and provide action definitions of type "expand" and "collapse".
        Specified by:
        isExpandable in interface ResourceType
        Returns:

      • getSizeLabel

        public String getSizeLabel(ContentEntity entity)
        Description copied from interface: ResourceType
        Access a short string that describes the "size" of an entity in some appropriate way. For example, the "size" of a folder might be the number of items it contains, the "size" of a text document might be the number of bytes it contains, and the "size" of a audio file might be its playing time at a normal speed. If the method returns null, the Resources tool will display the number of bytes if the entity is a ContentResource or the number of members if the entity is a ContentCollection. The string must be short. If it's longer than about 18 characters, it may be truncated arbitrarily, which may render it meaningless to users.
        Specified by:
        getSizeLabel in interface ResourceType
        Parameters:
        entity - The resource that's being displayed, or null indicating that the entity might not yet exist.
        Returns:
        A short string describing the size of an entity, or null.
        See Also:
        ResourceType.MAX_LENGTH_SHORT_SIZE_LABEL

      • getLongSizeLabel

        public String getLongSizeLabel(ContentEntity entity)
        Description copied from interface: ResourceType
        Access a short string that describes the "size" of an entity in some appropriate way. For example, the "size" of a folder might be the number of items it contains, the "size" of a text document might be the number of bytes it contains, and the "size" of a audio file might be its playing time at a normal speed. If the method returns null, the Resources tool will display the number of bytes if the entity is a ContentResource or the number of members if the entity is a ContentCollection. The string must be short. If it's longer than about 80 characters, it may be truncated arbitrarily, which may render it meaningless to users.
        Specified by:
        getLongSizeLabel in interface ResourceType
        Parameters:
        entity - The resource that's being displayed, or null indicating that the entity might not yet exist.
        Returns:
        A short string describing the size of an entity, or null.
        See Also:
        ResourceType.MAX_LENGTH_LONG_SIZE_LABEL
